thread.title: Tearful farewell to Manorama, Jaya hails her as sister
thread.title_full: Tearful farewell to Manorama, Jaya hails her as sister

author: PTI Chennai Tamil
title: Tearful farewell to Manorama, Jaya hails her as sister
text:
PTI
Chennai
Tamil Nadu on Sunday bid a tearful farewell to legendary Tamil actress Manorama as her body was cremated here after a funeral procession attended by thousands of people, fans, and members of the film fraternity. Earlier, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa arrived at Manorama's residence, placed a wreath and showered encomiums on the actress and hailed her as"elder sister."
"There are no words to describe my grief, she is my elder sister in film industry," she told Manorama's relatives. Reminiscing about her long association with her, she said Manorama used to affectionately serve her food whenever she went to her house. MGR had special affection for Manorama and Sivaji Ganesan used to hail her as a genius in acting, she added.
"She is truly a genius, there is no achiever like her in the Tamil film industry, not only before her and also no one is going to be born hereafter, her death is an irreparable loss, the vacuum left by her cannot be filled by anybody," she said.
With the body of the actress placed in a flower decked van, it slowly began winding its way to the cremation ground at Mylapore through major thoroughfares. As a mark of respect, film shootings were cancelled on Sunday. Manorama's son Boopathy performed the last rites.
